metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3572 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in python-pip in the way it handled Unicode separators ingit references. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to installa different revision on a repository. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data integrity. This is fixed in python-pip version21.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pip-whl - 20.0.2-5ubuntu1.5
python3-pip - 20.0.2-5ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-pip package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20.0.2-5ubuntu1.5').
